intro: Barosma acutata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved barosma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. It is well adapted to dry conditions and can tolerate salt spray, making it a resilient species. Barosma acutata plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and supporting local biodiversity.
